snippet: President Mohamed Morsi’s shake-up increased the role of Islamists in the government’s upper ranks but was not expected to lead to new policies.
abstract: President Mohamed Morsi swears in nine new cabinet members in reshuffle that increases role of Islamists in upper ranks of government but is not expected to herald any immediate policy shifts; cabinet shake-up is unlikely to assuage rift between Morsi's government and opposition.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi’s shake-up increased the role of Islamists in the government’s upper ranks but was not expected to lead to new policies.

headline.main: More Islamists Join Cabinet in Shuffling Within Egypt
headline.print_headline: More Islamists Join Cabinet In Shuffling Within Egypt
